data.title: Portland Multifamily and Affordable Housing Summit
data.meta_description: Bisnow's Portland Multifamily and Affordable Housing Summit delves into development and investment opportunities, lifestyle projects and addressing the growing need for affordable housing.
data.text:
Why You Won't Want To Miss This CRE Deal-Making Conference:

What You'll Learn From This Commercial Real Estate Event:

Explore current development and investment activity in Portland’s multifamily and affordable housing markets.

Examine how supply and demand are expected to impact market fundamentals moving forward.

Analyze the transition of Portland's multifamily market from a period of cap rate compression to cap rate expansion.

Investigate how updates to Portland's historic resource code, approved by the City Council, provide developers with more flexibility and fewer restrictions in historically significant neighborhoods, facilitating the development of affordable housing.

Discover how multifamily owners and developers are adjusting to changing resident demands throughout the region.

Engage in a discussion encompassing sustainability, wellness, AI integration, technology, and amenities.

Identify the neighborhoods that developers and investors are choosing in 2024 and explore which neighborhoods are experiencing the highest leasing activity for property owners.

Examine the national and regional policies and regulations that investors and developers are monitoring in 2024, and understand how these policies might impact future housing developments.

How You'll Do More Business From Attending This Summit: While Portland’s multifamily and affordable housing markets have faced continued headwinds in recent years, there are signs of improvement as financial hurdles ease and demographic trends remain favorable. More people are moving to the area due to its low cost and high quality of living relative to other West Coast cities. Join us for an insightful discussion on navigating Portland’s multifamily market, development and investment opportunities, lifestyle projects and addressing the growing need for affordable housing.

Projects & Deals To Be Discussed:

Alder 9: Construction of a 159-unit affordable housing project in the Buckman neighborhood in Portland, Oregon. Financing from all sources for the project totals nearly $90 million.

72Foster: Nestled in southeast Portland, LEED Certified community officers: Studio, One Bedroom, Two Bedroom and Three Bedroom apartment homes

Who You'll Network With At This Discussion: Owners, developers, investors, brokers, city and government officials, business consultants, architects, engineers, lawyers, accountants and bankers.

Why You Should Attend This Session: Bisnow events bring together the biggest power players in the industry to help you identify opportunities, build your network and expand your business. With the largest audience of commercial real estate professionals in the world, no one knows how to help your business more than we do.
